trans-unit.source: Encapsulates the HTTP intrinsic object that provides helper methods for processing Web requests.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityWrapper> class derives from the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase> class and serves as a wrapper for the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility> class.
This class exposes the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility> class while also exposing the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase> type.

The <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase> class enables you to replace the original implementation of the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility> class in your application with a custom implementation, such as when you perform unit testing outside the ASP.NET pipeline.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpServerUtilityWrapper"></xref> class.
The object that this wrapper class provides access to.
The httpServerUtility parameter is `null`.
Clears the most recent exception.
Creates a server instance of a COM object that is identified by the object's programmatic identifier (ProgID).
The class or type of object to create an instance of.
The new object.
An instance of the object could not be created.
Creates a server instance of a COM object that is identified by the object's type.
A type that represents the object to create.
The new object.
Creates a server instance of a COM object that is identified by the object's class identifier (CLSID).
The class identifier of the object to create an instance of.
The new object.
An instance of the object cannot be created.
Executes the handler for the specified virtual path in the context of the current process.
The URL of the handler to execute.
The current <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> object is `null`.
\- or -
An error occurred when the handler specified by path was executed.
path is `null`.
\- or -
path is not a virtual path.

Executes the handler for the specified virtual path in the context of the current process and specifies whether to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
The URL of the handler to execute.

`true` to preserve the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections; `false` to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
The current <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> object is `null`.
\- or -
An error occurred when the handler specified by path was executed.
path is `null`.
\- or -
path is not a virtual path.
Executes the handler for the specified virtual path in the context of the current process, using a <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> instance to capture output from the executed handler.
The `writer` parameter is passed by reference to the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityWrapper.Execute%2A> method.
To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the `writer` object.
For an example, see <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityWrapper.Execute%2A>.
The URL of the handler to execute.
An object to capture the output.
The current <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> is `null`.
\- or -
An error occurred when the handler specified by path was executed.
path is `null`.
\- or -
path is not a virtual path.

Executes the handler for the specified virtual path in the context of the current request, using a <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> instance to capture output from the page and a value that indicates whether to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
The URL of the handler to execute.
The object to capture the output.

`true` to preserve the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections; `false` to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
The current <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> instance is `null`.
\- or -
path ends with a period (.).
\- or -
An error occurred when the handler specified by path was executed.
path is `null`.
path is not a virtual path.

Executes the specified handler in the context of the current process, using a <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> instance to capture output from the executed handler and a value that specifies whether to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
The HTTP handler that implements the interface to transfer the current request to.
The object to capture the output.

`true` to preserve the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections; `false` to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
An error occurred when the handler specified by handler was executed.
The handler parameter is `null`.
Returns the most recent exception.
The previous exception that was thrown.
Decodes an HTML-encoded string and returns the decoded string.
The HTML string to decode.
The decoded text.
Decodes an HTML-encoded string and returns the results in a stream.
The `output` parameter is passed by reference to the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityWrapper.HtmlDecode%2A> method.
To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the `output` object.
For an example, see <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityWrapper.HtmlDecode%2A>.
The HTML string to decode.
The stream to contain the decoded string.
HTML-encodes a string and returns the encoded string.
The string to encode.
The HTML-encoded text.
HTML-encodes a string and sends the resulting output to an output stream.
The `output` parameter is passed by reference to the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityWrapper.HtmlEncode%2A> method.
To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the `output` object.
For an example, see <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityWrapper.HtmlEncode%2A>.
The string to encode.
The stream to contain the encoded string.
Gets the server's computer name.
The name of the server computer.
The computer name cannot be found.
Returns the physical file path that corresponds to the specified virtual path on the Web server.
The virtual path to get the physical path for.
The physical file path that corresponds to path.
The current <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> object is `null`.
Gets or sets the request time-out value in seconds.
The time-out value for requests.
The current <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> object is `null`.
The time-out period is `null` or otherwise cannot be set.
Terminates execution of the current process and starts execution of a page or handler that is specified with a URL.
The URL of the page or handler to execute.

Terminates execution of the current page and starts execution of a different page or handler by using the specified URL and a value that specifies whether to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequestBase.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequestBase.Form"></xref> collections.
The URL of the page or handler to execute.

`true` to preserve the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections; `false` to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
The current page request is a callback.

Terminates execution of the current process and starts execution of a new request, using a custom HTTP handler and a value that specifies whether to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
The HTTP handler to transfer the current request to.

`true` to preserve the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections; `false` to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
The current page request is a callback.
Asynchronously executes the end point at the specified URL.
The URL of the page or handler to execute.
The request requires the integrated pipeline mode of [!INCLUDE[iisver](~/includes/iisver-md.md)].
The server is not available to handle the request.
The path parameter is `null`.
The path parameter is invalid.

Asynchronously executes the endpoint at the specified URL and specifies whether to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequestBase.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequestBase.Form"></xref> collections.
The URL of the page to execute.

`true` to preserve the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections; `false` to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
The request requires the integrated pipeline mode of [!INCLUDE[iisver](~/includes/iisver-md.md)].
The server is not available to handle the request.
The path parameter is `null`.
The path parameter is invalid.
Asynchronously executes the endpoint at the specified URL by using the specified HTTP method and headers.
The URL of the page or handler to execute.

`true` to preserve the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections; `false` to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
The HTTP method (`GET`, `POST`, and so on) to use for the new request.
If `null`, the HTTP method of the original request is used.
A collection of request headers for the new request.
The request requires [!INCLUDE[iisver](~/includes/iisver-md.md)] running in integrated mode.
The server is not available to handle the request.
The path parameter is `null`.
The path parameter is invalid.
Performs an asynchronous execution of the specified URL using the specified HTTP method, headers, path, and options to preserve form values and preserve the user identity.
The path.

`true` to preserve the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections; `false` to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
The HTTP method to use in the new request.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> object that contains request headers for the new request.
`true` to preserve the user identity; otherwise, `false`.
Other overloads of this method call this method overload with the preserveUser parameter set to `true`.
The request requires the integrated pipeline mode of [!INCLUDE[iisver](~/includes/iisver-md.md)].
The server is not available to handle the request.
The path parameter is `null`.
The path parameter is invalid.
Decodes a URL-encoded string and returns the decoded string.
The string to decode.
The decoded text.
Decodes a URL-encoded string and sends the resulting output to a stream.
The `output` parameter is passed by reference to the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityWrapper.UrlDecode%2A> method.
To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the `output` object.
For an example, see <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility.HtmlDecode%2A>.
The HTML string to decode.
The stream to contain the decoded string.
URL-encodes a string and returns the encoded string.
The text to URL-encode.
The URL-encoded text.
URL-encodes a string and sends the resulting output to a stream.
The string to encode.
The stream to contain the encoded string.
URL-encodes the path section of a URL string.
The string to URL-encode.
The URL-encoded text.
Decodes a URL string token into an equivalent byte array by using base64 digits.
The URL string token to decode.
The byte array that contains the decoded URL string token.
The value of the input parameter is `null`.
Encodes a byte array into an equivalent string representation by using base64 digits, which makes it usable for transmission on the URL.
The byte array to encode.
The string that contains the encoded array if the length of input is greater than 1; otherwise, an empty string ("").
The value of the input parameter is `null`.
